name: PhysicalTherapy
title: Physical Therapy
description:
This value set is used to calculate OP-8 (MRI Lumbar Spine for Low Back Pain), a claims-based measure used in the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services' Hospital Outpatient Quality Reporting (HOQR) Program.

In calculation of OP-8, claims for physical therapy must appear in the 60 days preceding the MRI lumbar spine study to be considered an attempt at antecedent conservative therapy.
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This set of values contains CPT codes for physical therapy.),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this data element is to identify patients with evidence of physical therapy, which should occur in the 60 days preceding an MRI lumbar spine study.),(Inclusion Criteria: CPT codes for physical therapy are included in this value set.),(Exclusion Criteria: CPT codes not associated with physical therapy are excluded from this value set. Terminologies other than CPT are also excluded from this value set.)

concept.display: Therapeutic procedure, 1 or more areas, each 15 minutes; therapeutic exercises to develop strength and endurance, range of motion and flexibility

Therapeutic procedure, 1 or more areas, each 15 minutes; neuromuscular reeducation of movement, balance, coordination, kinesthetic sense, posture, and/or proprioception for sitting and/or standing activities
Therapeutic procedure, 1 or more areas, each 15 minutes; aquatic therapy with therapeutic exercises
Therapeutic procedure, 1 or more areas, each 15 minutes; massage, including effleurage, petrissage and/or tapotement (stroking, compression, percussion)
Manual therapy techniques (eg, mobilization/ manipulation, manual lymphatic drainage, manual traction), 1 or more regions, each 15 minutes

contains.display: Therapeutic procedure, 1 or more areas, each 15 minutes; therapeutic exercises to develop strength and endurance, range of motion and flexibility

Therapeutic procedure, 1 or more areas, each 15 minutes; neuromuscular reeducation of movement, balance, coordination, kinesthetic sense, posture, and/or proprioception for sitting and/or standing activities
Therapeutic procedure, 1 or more areas, each 15 minutes; aquatic therapy with therapeutic exercises
Therapeutic procedure, 1 or more areas, each 15 minutes; massage, including effleurage, petrissage and/or tapotement (stroking, compression, percussion)
Manual therapy techniques (eg, mobilization/ manipulation, manual lymphatic drainage, manual traction), 1 or more regions, each 15 minutes
